content.description: Using consecutive underclings and precise foot work, climb your way to a blind finish.
content.location: Right of Dear Jim

content.description: Start on pockets off cheater stone. Hanging start. Make use of good pockets and small edges to anchors up and right.
content.location: Just left of Recycler on main cliff face

content.description: Start off cheater stone on two shallow pockets. Campus up to two hand ledge and use pockets and small edges to gain the face. A strenuous clip leads to the crux and then easier climbing up top.
content.location: Right of Nuts and Honey

content.description: Great route! Sustained route to great finish.
content.location: Right of The Phat and the Dope on the main cliff face

content.description: Thin face moves to overhang crux. The 2nd bolt is too dicey to clip. I would haul up a stick clip until I come up with something better. The run to anchors from 2nd bolt is 5.5ish.
content.protection: 2 bolts to anchors of Dear Jim.
content.location: Start on sloper from ground right of the boulder.

content.description: Bouldery start to a insecure slabby finish.
content.location: Just right of Recyclable Stone below the large overhang.

content.description: Delicately balance and crimp your way up hidden holds to the roof and figure out how to clip anchors.
content.location: Left of Dear Jim on main cliff face

content.description: Moderate face leads to a thin crack below big ledges.
content.location: Between NWO and SWW.  Start at the graffitti.

content.description: Undercling an arching crack to under roof. Traverse right to a bolt. Placing protection can be strenuous but crack eats up cams. Clip bolt and pull roof using crack. Mixed route.
content.location: Just right of 12 pack in the crack

content.description: Stick clip high first bolt. Figure out crux, Take a break at the  2nd clip before the exciting finish.
content.location: Just right of Garbage Warrior.

content.description: Classic route. Begin on some moderate moves with some tricky feet. Continue through the crux as it becomes slightly overhung. Be sure to take advantage of the dyno up top, as this is what makes the route so good! This route stays fairly dry after a rain... except for one key spot (which explains the name).
content.protection: 5 bolts & SS chains with rappel rings
content.location: Two routes to the left of the mixed crack climb called Diagonal To Nowhere. Look for a good sized shelf at the top of the climb.

content.description: Great workout or warm-up when dry..
content.protection: Pad would be nice, but not essential.
content.location: Horizontal seam starting at bottom of stairs and traversing left or start left below Diagonal to Nowhere and go right..

climbs.name: She Keeps it on the Mantel

content.description: Don't be tempted by the tree or anything left of it. Strictly off route.
content.location: Face left of Springfield Arch

content.description: Great moderate route with a crux that makes you think about half way up. Since it is a brand new route, it is a little dirty towards the top, but that should cleanup with more climbers on the wall.
content.location: Located on Clear Creek Crag- two routes left of 12 pack (10c) and on wall right of arete with Excellent Ella (5.6)

content.description: Recycler to 3rd bolt, move right on side-pulls and knee bar to clip 4th. Gain blunt arete using fierce pockets.  Clip 5th chest high then be rewarded with fantastic pockets at the roof.
content.location: Right variation of Recycler. The black slab.

content.description: Start below the bolts on "She Keeps It on the Mantel". Boulder up and into the crack. Follow the crack up and right using secure jams to gain the right facing flake. Continue up to the first roof moving out left to gain a large crack up to the second roof. Move left to clip the third bolt continuing to the anchors on "She Keeps It on the Mantel".
content.protection: Standard rack & one bolt. A number 4 C4 is helpful in the roof.
content.location: Clear Creek Crag (MRG). Between "She Keeps It on the Mantel" & "Springfield Arch"

content.description: The start is not really in line with the rest of the routes difficulty, but its a good one nonetheless. Utilize the crack, balance up and over a few ledges and clip anchors
content.location: Left of Devine Root

content.description: Pull through the start of Recyclable Stone, then continue straight up the concave face using small edges and side-pulls.Finish at Recyclable Stone anchors.
content.protection: Anchors of Recyclable Stone for TR
content.location: The left variation of Recyclable Stone. You should lead Recyclable Stone then top rope this route.

content.description: Rumored to be the first route bolted in Springfield in the early 90s. Look for 3 stacked roofs with several fixed draws.
content.location: Bolted route directly left of a large vertical crack. The crack begins as an offwidth.

content.description: Stick clip second bolt. Campus till you gain feet. Shake out at big ledge and fire through crux. Clipping anchors can be interesting if you choose wrong hold to clip from.
content.location: On main face of wall in between Man with a Beard and Trash.com

content.description: Probably want to stick clip 2nd bolt, or be REALLY strong. Originally intentioned to stay left thru micro edges as Man With a Beard.It can be done by trending right on bigger holds as The Pinch.
content.protection: 3 bolts to anchors of Recyclable Stone.
content.location: Start just right of Arch on large pinch.

content.description: Beginning on some small pockets, crimp your way up this the route on tiny holds with some very physical moves to some slightly overhanging chains.
content.location: Second bolted route to the right of the obvious crack that begins as an offwidth.

content.description: This route begins in the obvious off width and continues up to a flaring layback crack. Use anchors of Trash Talk
content.protection: Gear to Anchors for Trash Talk
content.location: Offwidth between Recycler and Trash Talk on main cliff face

content.description: One set of anchors with 3 different starts. .
content.location: As soon as you cross the stone bridge.

content.description: Begin on small crimps with technical moves. Climb through several bolts to reach much easier climbing towards the top of the wall.
content.location: First bolted route on a blank looking wall to the left of Slippery When Wet.

content.description: Chossy start to stopper crux at 2nd bolt.  Find relief on small horizontal seems.  Follow crack up to anchors.
content.location: Just left of Recyclable Stone (they share anchors)

content.description: Long moves lead to a good rest before run to the top.
content.location: Left variation of Recycler. Trend left after 2nd bolt of Recycler.

content.description: Nice pockets and features at the bottom lead to a blank middle section crux where tiny crimps and good balance are needed to get further up the wall.
content.location: Just left of 12 Pack (10c) on the Clearcreek Wall.

content.description: Thin face to a tricky bulge then traverse to SWW anchors.
content.location: The face right of SWW.

content.description: This is a great route! A sequential, powerful start leads to a surprise ending.
content.location: Right of The Underling and left of Root for Me

content.description: Begin climbing the crack for 20 feet on good holds and good feet. Beware of the loose blocks towards the middle of the crack while placing gear. Head right for the chains at the top of the crack.
content.protection: Standard rack w/ 1 bolt and 2 anchors
content.location: Follow the approach trail into the gorge, turning right as you reach the bottom. Follow wall for 50 feet, looking for a crack with a bolt and anchor at the top.

content.description: Starts under first bolt and traverse left briefly into Root for Me. Clip 2nd bolt and trend up right to anchors. It is believed this route was bolted by Mike Johnson in the late 80s.
content.location: Right of Root for Me

content.description: 1 bolt protects a hard to protect start and 1 bolt is up top to protect traverse to anchors. Climb crack in between. This route takes nuts and cams galore. It is a very good route for beginning tradsters comfortable at this grade.
content.protection: Two bolts, gear to two ring anchor. Mixed route
content.location: Right of Steve-O and left of The Underling

content.description: Start is crux although the top is a little in your face as well.
content.location: right of 12 pack

content.description: Classic route. Begin on jugs to a technical middle section. Watch out for the run-out between the first & second bolt as there is ground fall potential. If you can pull the bottom moves though, the middle should be no problem.
content.location: The first bolted route to the right of Dad's Wall.

content.description: The first area on the right as you enter the gorge from the main stairwell. Nowhere (5.10+) is the first route you'll reach as you cross the rock bridge that goes along the wall before going all the way down the stairs.
